Zinio digital magazines are here and flying off the e–shelves!

Nov 24, 2015 • Helen Haynes

If you haven’t had a look at our new digital magazine service you really must. We have such a great collection of magazines available and the best bit is, they are free and you can keep them forever.

Whenever I tell people this, they can’t quite believe it — so much so that I sometimes doubt it myself. But yes, they definitely are free and I’ve got an iPad full various titles to prove it.

We’ve launched the service with a selection of 34 top name magazines covering titles from BBC History to Marie Clare and Top Gear Magazine to the New Scientist. Every single one seems to have been a hit with customers (the only exception being the golf magazine!). Clearly our stock librarian Brandon made a good initial selection.

</figure>

All you need is a library card number and a device to read your magazine on, such as your PC or laptop at home, or a smartphone or tablet on the move. Once the magazine has been downloaded you can read it offline so it’s perfect for when you’re out and about (unless you’ve only got a PC which might be a bit cumbersome to carry around).

The Christmas issues are all coming out this month. Perfect for discovering new recipes in BBC Good Food, getting Christmas inspiration from Good Housekeeping or finding something special to make for Christmas gifts in Knit Today and Cross Stitch Crazy.
